title: Verb patterns with adjectives - 2
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use the B1gerundB2 or the B1to-infinitiveB2.

sentence: I don't like this macrame course. I'm just wasting my time
explain: After 'waste something (time, money, etc.) we use the gerund.

sentence: (cause) you so much trouble, but I'll never be able
explain: There's a preposition (for), so we need the gerund.
After 'be able' we use the to-infinitive.

sentence: (get) a job now. I'm good at
(sit) at a desk. Will you hire me?
explain: There's a preposition (at) so we use the gerund.

sentence: (meet) Tom. It's by chance that we haven't met for a year.
explain: After 'try' we use the to-infinitive if it's not a suggestion.

sentence: (do) this job, the boss will be happy.
(steal) the passwords. Everyone knows it was you.
After the meeting, our boss suggested
I don't think Bobby is guilty of
(commit) this crime. I can't imagine him
explain: There's a preposition here (of), so we need the gerund.
After 'imagine' or 'imagine sb doing' we use the gerund.
